definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Extensibility to other typed topics is possible through further specialization.
sentences.chinese: 通过专门化，就有可能扩展到其他分类主题。

sentences.english: This domino effect can be avoided by using domain specialization.
sentences.chinese: 可以使用领域专门化来避免这种多米诺骨牌效应。

sentences.english: This constrained domain makes specialization processes relatively easy to implement and maintain.
sentences.chinese: 这个限定的领域使得专门化过程相对容易实现和维护。

sentences.english: However, it is a very specialized cloud.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它是一个非常专门化的云。

sentences.english: You should never specialize from the elements of the highlight domain.
sentences.chinese: 决不要从突出显示域的元素进行专门化。

sentences.english: Specialization allows the sum of the parts of the organization to be greater than the whole.
sentences.chinese: 专门化令组织各部分的总和大于整体。

sentences.english: The element entities are necessary to permit domain specialization.
sentences.chinese: 要允许域专门化元素实体是必需的。

sentences.english: The specialized information exchange of Iching and the landscape architecture and geomancy.
sentences.chinese: 易学和景观建筑风水学的专门化信息的交流。

sentences.english: This practice lets other domains merge their specializations into the current domain.
sentences.chinese: 这一做法可让其它域将它们的专门化合并进当前域中。

sentences.english: Both are now United Nations specialized agencies.
sentences.chinese: 两个公亩现在联合国使代理机构专门化。

definition: socialization/to socialize/to fit into society/to train sb for society
informatization (the Information Age analog of industrialization)
